intro: Verticordia bifimbriata, commonly known as the Two-lobed Featherflower, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas. Its flowers are usually pale pink to white and bloom during the autumn season. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
